abstract: More restaurants are going cashless, pushing credit and debit cards and mobile apps for payments instead, asserting policy improves customer service, lowers operational costs and makes workplace safer; trend worries advocates of consumer privacy; some protests by customers of several chains have led to change in rule.
lead_paragraph: Although America is far from being completely cashless, some restaurants are betting that customers will be comfortable forgoing cash for convenience.

headline.main: At Sweetgreen, a Suitcase Full of Cash Won’t Buy You Lunch
headline.print_headline: Where a Suitcase Full of Cash Won’t Buy You Lunch

snippet: Although America is far from being completely cashless, some restaurants are betting that customers will be comfortable forgoing cash for convenience....
